channel.title: Connection
channel.description: Ok.. so I was gone for 2-3 days. My server worked fine before I left I came back and no one could connect. I've re-port forwarded checked no-ip. even made a new one and redid everything. Still can't connect. I have no idea what to do now.

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Then all I can suggest is double check that your IP didn’t change and make sure you don’t have some kind of firewall or new antivirus blocking connections.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:2, topic:445625”]What has happened to me before is that the number (I forgot what it is called) that you enter in your router settings can change.

EXAMPLE. Before it was 192.1.1.103 but for some reason the 103 changed to 101.

If you get what I’m saying, I just don’t know the proper names for things. Also make sure your firewall is allowing connections or is turned off.[/quote]
Default gateway,
and it hasn’t changed ._.
At least I don’t think so.
I just checked

Read full topic

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

What has happened to me before is that the number (I forgot what it is called) that you enter in your router settings can change.

EXAMPLE. Before it was 192.1.1.103 but for some reason the 103 changed to 101.

If you get what I’m saying, I just don’t know the proper names for things. Also make sure your firewall is allowing connections or is turned off.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

Ok… so
I was gone for 2-3 days.
My server worked fine before I left I came back and no one could connect.
I’ve re-port forwarded checked no-ip.
even made a new one and redid everything.
Still can’t connect.
I have no idea what to do now.

Read full topic
